Audio Description: This World War II poster encourages students to be a victory farm volunteer. The image on the poster is a color photo of a teenage boy and girl on their way to work in the fields. The boy is on the left, holding a pitchfork and hoe over his right shoulder. The boy is smiling and he has red hair and freckles.  He is wearing a blue shirt with white stripes that give it a checkerboard pattern. To his right is a blonde girl. She is smiling and wearing a red blouse. The background behind the two youths is blue, and printed in white letters above them are the words: “Going my way?” Printed in a white strip at the lower portion of the poster are the words “Be a Victory Farm Volunteer of the U.S. Crop Corps.” On the lower right hand portion of the poster is the logo for the Victory Farm Volunteer Program, which is the white capital letters VFV in a blue circle within a red capital “C”.
Creator: United States. War Food Administration. Extension Service
Description: Poster, 46.5 x 66 cm, artist: Anton Brueli

Title: Going our way to work for victory on the farm front?: be a victory farm volunteer for the U.S. Crop Corps
